DOCNAME: CASE OF VENERA-NORD-VEST BORTA A.G. v. MOLDOVA
CONCLUSION: Government's request for a strike-out rejected;Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of P1-1;Pecuniary damage - financial award;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant concluded a contract with another private company . According to the contract , the applicant would locate assets belonging to the debtors of the second company in exchange for a commission . Since the second company failed to comply with the contract , the applicant brought an action against it seeking damages for breach of the contract .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found in favour of the applicant and awarded it CARDINAL Moldovan lei ( MDL ) ( the equivalent of CARDINAL euros ( ORG ) at that time ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE ORG of GPE and ORG respectively dismissed the second company ’s appeals and upheld the judgment of the first - instance court , which thus became final .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Prosecutor General lodged with the Plenary of ORG a request for annulment of the judgment in favour of the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Plenary of ORG upheld ORG request for annulment and quashed the judgment . It adopted a new judgment dismissing the applicant ’s action .

CARDINAL . Following the communication of the case by ORG , ORG asked ORG to lodge a request with the Plenary of ORG in order to quash its judgment of DATE and to discontinue the request for annulment proceedings . He considered that the quashing of a final judgment in favour of the applicant following the annulment proceedings had breached the applicant ’s rights under the Convention .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Prosecutor General complied with ORG request . He lodged a revision request relying on section CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( j ) of LAW ( the “ ORG ” , see paragraph CARDINAL below ) and indicated that the applicant and the Government intended to conclude a friendly settlement agreement .

CARDINAL . By a judgment of CARDINAL DATE the Plenary of ORG dismissed the Prosecutor ’s request for revision on the ground that the parties had not submitted any evidence of the alleged friendly settlement .
CARDINAL . NORP The relevant domestic law concerning the quashing of a final judgment was set out in LAW , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § CARDINAL , DATE .
CARDINAL . The Code of Civil Procedure of DATE , insofar as relevant , reads as follows :

j ) When the Government of GPE , represented by ORG , or ORG has started a procedure of friendly settlement in a pending case against GPE , and the Government consider that by a final decision of a court a fundamental right guaranteed by LAW or by LAW has been breached .

k ) When ORG has found a violation of fundamental rights and liberties , as well as when it has found that the interested person could obtain , in accordance with domestic law , at least partial reparation by way of annulment of a judgment pronounced by a domestic court .

CARDINAL . In NORP v. ORG on DATE ORG upheld the Prosecutor ’s request for revision lodged in accordance with section CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( j ) following the Government ’s Agent request . It discontinued the annulment proceedings , acknowledged the violation of the applicant ’s rights under LAW and awarded her compensation in respect of pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage and for costs and expenses .

CARDINAL . In Dumitru Grosu v. ORG on DATE ORG upheld the Prosecutor ’s request for revision lodged on DATE in accordance with section CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( j ) following the Government ’s Agent request . It discontinued the annulment proceedings , acknowledged the violation of the applicant ’s rights under LAW No . CARDINAL to the LAW and awarded him compensation in respect of pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage and for costs and expenses .

CARDINAL . In ORG v. ORG on DATE ORG upheld the applicant ’s action following the re - opening of the proceedings upon the ORG ’s request for revision lodged in accordance with section CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( j ) . It acknowledged the violation of the applicant ’s rights under LAW and LAW No . CARDINAL to the Convention and awarded him compensation in respect of pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage and for costs and expenses .

CARDINAL . In ORG v. JSC PERSON on DATE ORG dismissed the Prosecutor ’s request for revision lodged in accordance with section CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( j ) following the Government ’s Agent request . It found that the Government had failed to submit any evidence of the violation of the applicant company ’s rights under the Convention . ORG also stated it could not re - open the case until the ORG had adopted a judgment on the merits of the case .
